> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/willmcgugan/rich/pull/365?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [e75649a...a044f1a](https://codecov.io/gh/willmcgugan/rich/pull/365?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

@willmcgugan Hi, thanks for looking at my WIP! I was trying to figure out where the coverage decrease was coming from, but it seems it isn't from any of the files I made changes to (provided I'm intepreting the codecov report correctly). I have also added tests for `containers.py` to the PR and have marked it ready for review.

I also realize that codecov ignores several files that I have added tests for, should these be removed?

What files are being ignored by codecov?

I'm beginning to think there may be something wrong with codecov configuration.

Tests look good. Will merge soon. 👍

Looking at the [codecov report](https://codecov.io/gh/willmcgugan/rich/pull/365?src=pr&el=continue)
It seems the following files are being ignored?
* ‘tests/test_containers.py’
* ‘tests/test_table.py’
* ‘tests/test_measure.py’
* ‘tests/test_padding.py’
* ‘tests/table.py’

Screenshot:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40609285/95620953-81e2bf00-0aa3-11eb-8045-3ab246f7d9ea.png)

That is strange. The tests/ directory is excluded from coverage, but I have no idea why it would ignore table.py.

Nothing in the configuration I could see that could cause this, and I'm sure it was working previously.

Safe to say, something has gone wrong with codecov. This PR has definitely increased coverage.
